abstract: Indiana becomes first state to enact religious objections bill as Gov Mike Pence signs controversial measure into law; critics say bill is discriminatory against gay people but supporters contend law protects businesses from being compelled to provide same-sex wedding services if they choose not to because of religious beliefs.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Mike Pence signed a bill that would ban state and local laws that “substantially burden” the ability of people — including businesses and associations — to follow their religious beliefs.

headline.main: Indiana: Bill Signed Allowing Denial of Service to Gays
headline.print_headline: Indiana: Bill Signed Allowing Denial of Service to Gays

snippet: Gov. Mike Pence signed a bill that would ban state and local laws that “substantially burden” the ability of people — including businesses and associations — to follow their religious beliefs.

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
